intro: Pterodiscus brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Pterodiscus brasiliensis is also noted for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
